#define CUBIC(A)

#define DBLNZ(A)

Functions

dsp * mkgt (LOC_T *xloc, LOC_T *ploc, double *amp, LOC_T *saloc, int saorc, double scale, double *displace, int do_partial)
 Returns the transpose of a average gradient operator that converts the OPDs defined on xloc to subapertures defines on saloc with ploc as the intermediate pupil plane.
dsp * mkg (LOC_T *xloc, LOC_T *ploc, double *amp, LOC_T *saloc, int saorc, double scale, double *displace, int do_partial)
 Returns the transpose of mkgt().

Detailed Description

Contains function that creates average gradient operator.

Contains function that creates ztilt gradient operator.

Function Documentation

dsp* mkgt ( LOC_T *  xloc,
LOC_T *  ploc,
double *  amp,
LOC_T *  saloc,
int  saorc,
double  scale,
double *  displace,
int  do_partial 
)

Returns the transpose of a average gradient operator that converts the OPDs defined on xloc to subapertures defines on saloc with ploc as the intermediate pupil plane.

Parameters:
xloc the grid on which OPDs are defined
ploc the grid on the aperture plan
amp the amplitude on ploc
saloc Coordinate of the subapertures
saorc 0: saloc is the center of the subapertures. 1: saloc is the origin of the subapertures.
scale cone effect
displace displacement due to beam angle (2 vector). similar as accphi routines
do_partial 1: use points that are outside of by close to a subaperture. 0: do not use. 
00137                              : saloc is the center of the subapertures. 1: saloc is the origin of the subapertures.*/
00138        double scale,    /**<cone effect*/
00139        double *displace,/**<displacement due to beam angle (2 vector). similar as accphi routines*/
00140        int do_partial   /**<1: use points that are outside of by close to a subaperture. 0: do not use.*/
00141        )
00142 {
00143     /*
00144       
00145       Create an average gradient influence matrix from XLOC to SALOC, with
00146       amplitude maps defined on PLOC. PLOC and SALOC are defined on the same
00147       plan. The offset *displace* and scaling *scale* is between PLOC/SALOC and
00148       XLOC, when projected onto XLOC plane,
00149       SALOC->SALOC*scale+displace. PLOC->PLOC*scale+dispace. There are no offset
00150       or scaling between PLOC and SALOC
00151 
00152       saorc: SALOC is subaperture origin or center. 
00153       1: origin (lower left corner), 
00154       0: center.
00155     */
00156     double *ampcopy;
00157     double dsa2;
00158     double scx, scy;
00159     double weight[2];
00160     double dx1,dx2;
00161     double dp1,dp2,poffset[2];
00162     double displacex=0, displacey=0;
00163    
00164     int nsa,isa;
00165     int limx, limy;
00166     int same;
00167     double dx=xloc->dx;
00168     double dp=ploc->dx;
00169     double dsa=saloc->dx;
00170 
00171     nsa=saloc->nloc;
00172     dx1=1./dx;
00173     dp1=1./dp;
00174     dx2=scale*dx1;
00175 
00176     /*
00177       if do_partial is 1, will use points that are outside of the subaperture,
00178       but contribute.
00179     */
00180     /*notice, this map is in matlab index*/
00181     loc_create_map(ploc);
00182     poffset[0]=ploc->map->ox;
00183     poffset[1]=ploc->map->oy;
00184     if(xloc->locx && ploc->locx != xloc->locx){
00185     /*
00186       If XLOC is present and different from PLOC, 
00187       treat the misregistration
00188       as between PLOC and XLOC. SALOC and PLOC has no misregistration.
00189     */
00190     same=0;
00191     loc_create_map(xloc);
00192     poffset[0]*=-dp1;
00193     poffset[1]*=-dp1;
00194 
00195     /*displace between PLOC(SALOC) and XLOC. Only used if same==0;*/
00196     displacex=(displace[0]-xloc->map->ox)*dx1;
00197     displacey=(displace[1]-xloc->map->oy)*dx1;  
00198     dp2=dp1;
00199     if(fabs(scale-1)>1.e-10)
00200         fprintf(stderr,"This is a bug in mkg to do three plane mkg when scale!=1\n");
00201     }else{
00202     /*
00203       If XLOC is missing or XLOC and PLOC are the same, treat the
00204       misregistration as between SALOC and PLOC
00205     */
00206     same=1;
00207     poffset[0]=(displace[0]-ploc->map->ox)*dp1;
00208     poffset[1]=(displace[1]-ploc->map->oy)*dp1;
00209     dp2=dp1*scale;
00210     }
00211 
00212     
00213     /*Spacing of half subaperture on pupil plane.*/
00214     dsa2=dsa/2.*dp2;
00215     /*To store the weights.*/
00216 
00217     poffset[0]+=dsa2*saorc;/*offset to SALOC to make it subaperture center.*/
00218     poffset[1]+=dsa2*saorc;
00219     
00220     long (*pmaps)[ploc->map->nx]=(long (*)[ploc->map->nx])ploc->map->p;
00221     long (*xmaps)[xloc->map->nx]=(long (*)[xloc->map->nx])xloc->map->p;
00222     double amp2[3][3];
00223     double wtfull[4]={0.5/3, 1./3, 0.5, 0.5};
00224     double *wtalpha, *wtbeta;
00225     double signx, signy;
00226     double ampsum;
00227     double limx1, limx2, limy1, limy2;
00228     double alpha1, alpha2, beta1, beta2;
00229     double dplocx,plocx,dplocy,plocy;
00230     double wt0,wtsum;
00231     int nplocx,nplocy;
00232     int ipix,ipix2,itmp,jtmp;
00233     int indx[2],indy[2];
00234     int valid=1;
00235     int iw;
00236     int iphi;
00237     if(!same && amp){
00238     /*
00239       Copy and modify amplitude map to fix boundry
00240       issues when propage between two planes.  This
00241       generally applies to the case that XLOC is smaller
00242       than PLOC.
00243     */
00244     ampcopy=malloc(sizeof(double)*ploc->nloc);
00245     memcpy(ampcopy,amp,sizeof(double)*ploc->nloc);
00246     for(ipix=0; ipix<ploc->nloc; ipix++){
00247         plocx=ploc->locx[ipix]*dx2+displacex;
00248         plocy=ploc->locy[ipix]*dx2+displacey;
00249         SPLIT(plocx,dplocx,nplocx);
00250         SPLIT(plocy,dplocy,nplocy);
00251         /*Find out whether this PLOC point has XLOC points associated,
00252           if not, will scale the amplitude of this PLOC point.*/
00253         wtsum=0;
00254         ADDWT(nplocx,1-dplocx,nplocy,1-dplocy);
00255         ADDWT(1+nplocx,dplocx,nplocy,1-dplocy);
00256         ADDWT(nplocx,1-dplocx,1+nplocy,dplocy);
00257         ADDWT(1+nplocx,dplocx,1+nplocy,dplocy);
00258         ampcopy[ipix]*=wtsum;
00259     }
00260     }else{
00261     ampcopy=amp;
00262     }
00263     if(do_partial){
00264     wtalpha=(double*)alloca(sizeof(double)*4);
00265     wtbeta =(double*)alloca(sizeof(double)*4);
00266     }else{
00267     wtalpha=(double*)wtfull;
00268     wtbeta =(double*)wtfull;
00269     }
00270     /*if no amplitude weighting, set all to one.*/
00271     if(!amp){
00272     for(jtmp=0; jtmp<3; jtmp++){
00273         for(itmp=0;itmp<3;itmp++){
00274         amp2[jtmp][itmp]=1;
00275         }
00276     }
00277     }
00278     dsp *GS0t[2];
00279     long nzmax[2];
00280     long *restrict pp[2];
00281     long *restrict pi[2];
00282     double  *restrict px[2];
00283     long count[2];
00284     for(iw=0; iw<2; iw++){
00285     nzmax[iw]=nsa*(dsa/dx)*16;//four row in each side.
00286     GS0t[iw]=spnew(xloc->nloc, nsa, nzmax[iw]);
00287     pp[iw]=GS0t[iw]->p; 
00288     pi[iw]=GS0t[iw]->i; 
00289     px[iw]=GS0t[iw]->x;
00290     count[iw]=0;
00291     }
00292     for(isa=0; isa<nsa; isa++){
00293     for(iw=0; iw<2; iw++){
00294         pp[iw][isa]=count[iw];
00295     }
00296     /*center of subaperture when mapped onto PLOC MAP.*/
00297     scx=saloc->locx[isa]*dp2+poffset[0];
00298     scy=saloc->locy[isa]*dp2+poffset[1];
00299     ampsum=0; /*Accumulated amplitude integral in this subaperture*/
00300     /*Boundary of PLOC points covered by this subaperture.*/
00301     limx1=(scx-dsa2);
00302     limx2=(scx+dsa2);
00303     limy1=(scy-dsa2);
00304     limy2=(scy+dsa2);
00305     /*
00306       was the following when only account for fully illuminated subaps.
00307       for (limy=FLOOR(limy1); limy<CEIL(limy2)+1; limy++){
00308       for (limx=FLOOR(limx1); limx<CEIL(limx2)+1; limx++){
00309       The new limits are used to include points that are outside of 
00310       but adjacent to the subaperture
00311     */
00312         
00313     for (limy=CEIL(limy1)-1; limy<FLOOR(limy2)+2; limy++){
00314         for (limx=CEIL(limx1)-1; limx<FLOOR(limx2)+2; limx++){
00315         PMAP(ipix,limx,limy);
00316 
00317         if (ipix--){
00318             weight[0]=0;
00319             weight[1]=0;
00320             /*if amplitude map is defined, fetch the 3x3 map surrounding this point.*/
00321             if(amp){
00322             for(jtmp=0; jtmp<3; jtmp++){
00323                 for(itmp=0; itmp<3; itmp++){
00324                 PMAP(ipix2,limx+itmp-1,limy+jtmp-1);
00325                 if(ipix2--){
00326                     amp2[jtmp][itmp]=ampcopy[ipix2];
00327                 }else{
00328                     amp2[jtmp][itmp]=0;
00329                 }
00330                 }
00331             }
00332             }
00333             /*
00334               Integrate over the four quadrants surround the point
00335               ipix, inside the subaperture
00336               limx, limy are the coordinate of the point in PLOC MAP.
00337               [limx1,limx2] [limy1,limy2] bound the subaperture.
00338 
00339               Notice that the coordinates are positive to the left/top for integral.
00340             */
00341             /*left use 0 1*/
00342             alpha1=limx-limx2;/*The lower bound to do integral (right)*/
00343             alpha2=limx-limx1;/*The upper bound to do integral (left)*/
00344             if(do_partial||(alpha1<TOL && alpha2>1.-TOL)){
00345             indx[0]=0; indx[1]=1;
00346             signx=1.;
00347             /*bottom use 0 1*/
00348             beta1=limy-limy2;
00349             beta2=limy-limy1;
00350             if(do_partial||(beta1<TOL && beta2>1.-TOL)){
00351                 indy[0]=0; indy[1]=1;
00352                 signy=1.;
00353                 DO_CALC;
00354             }
00355             /*top use 2 1 */
00356             beta1=limy1-limy;
00357             beta2=limy2-limy;
00358             if(do_partial||(beta1<TOL && beta2>1.-TOL)){
00359                 indy[0]=2; indy[1]=1;
00360                 signy=-1.;
00361                 DO_CALC;
00362             }
00363             }
00364             /*right  use 2 1*/
00365             alpha1=limx1-limx;
00366             alpha2=limx2-limx;
00367             if(do_partial||(alpha1<TOL && alpha2>1.-TOL)){
00368             indx[0]=2; indx[1]=1;
00369             signx=-1.;
00370             /*bottom use 0 1*/
00371             beta1=limy-limy2;
00372             beta2=limy-limy1;
00373             if(do_partial||(beta1<TOL && beta2>1.-TOL)){
00374                 indy[0]=0; indy[1]=1;
00375                 signy=1.;
00376                 DO_CALC;
00377             }
00378             /*top use 2 1 */
00379             beta1=limy1-limy;
00380             beta2=limy2-limy;
00381             if(do_partial||(beta1<TOL && beta2>1.-TOL)){
00382                 indy[0]=2; indy[1]=1;
00383                 signy=-1.;
00384                 DO_CALC;
00385             }
00386             }
00387             for(iw=0; iw<2; iw++){
00388             if(count[iw]+4>nzmax[iw]){
00389                 nzmax[iw]=nzmax[iw]*2;
00390                 spsetnzmax(GS0t[iw], nzmax[iw]);
00391                 pp[iw]=GS0t[iw]->p; 
00392                 pi[iw]=GS0t[iw]->i; 
00393                 px[iw]=GS0t[iw]->x;
00394             }
00395             if(fabs(weight[iw])>TOL){
00396                 if(same){
00397                 /*XLOC and PLOC are the same, 
00398                   and no misregistration.*/
00399                 pi[iw][count[iw]]=ipix;
00400                 px[iw][count[iw]++]=weight[iw];
00401                 }else{
00402                 /*
00403                   XLOC and PLOC are not the same, find the
00404                   points on XLOC that couples in to ipix.
00405                 */
00406 
00407                 plocx=ploc->locx[ipix]*dx2+displacex;
00408                 plocy=ploc->locy[ipix]*dx2+displacey;
00409                 SPLIT(plocx,dplocx,nplocx);
00410                 SPLIT(plocy,dplocy,nplocy);
00411                 //info2("weight[%d]=%g\n",iw,weight[iw]);
00412                 //info2("(%g, %g, %d), (%g, %g, %d)\n",
00413                 //    plocx,dplocx,nplocx,
00414                 //   plocy,dplocy,nplocy);
00415                 wtsum=0;
00416                 ADDWT(nplocx,1-dplocx,nplocy,1-dplocy);
00417                 ADDWT(1+nplocx,dplocx,nplocy,1-dplocy);
00418                 ADDWT(nplocx,1-dplocx,1+nplocy,dplocy);
00419                 ADDWT(1+nplocx,dplocx,1+nplocy,dplocy);
00420                 //info2("wtsum=%g\n",wtsum);
00421                 wtsum=1./wtsum;
00422                 /*We are computing gradients on the PLOC.
00423                   This gradient is scaled by 1/scale in XLOC*/
00424                 if(!same)
00425                     wtsum/=scale;
00426 #define INTERP(A,B,C,D)                         \
00427     XMAP(iphi,A,C);                         \
00428     if(iphi--){                             \
00429     /*Check whether we already have the weight for this point.*/    \
00430     if(fabs(wt0=weight[iw]*(B)*(D)*wtsum)>TOL){         \
00431         /*info2("(%d,%d)=%g)\n",isa+nsa*iw,iphi,wt0);*/     \
00432         for(itmp=pp[iw][isa]; itmp<count[iw]; itmp++){      \
00433         if(pi[iw][itmp]==iphi){                 \
00434             px[iw][itmp]+=wt0;                  \
00435             break;                      \
00436         }                           \
00437         }                               \
00438         if(itmp == count[iw]){/*not found*/             \
00439         pi[iw][count[iw]]=iphi;                 \
00440         px[iw][count[iw]++]=wt0;                \
00441         }                               \
00442     }                               \
00443     }
00444                     
00445                 INTERP(nplocx,1-dplocx,nplocy,1-dplocy);
00446                 INTERP(1+nplocx,dplocx,nplocy,1-dplocy);
00447                 INTERP(nplocx,1-dplocx,1+nplocy,dplocy);
00448                 INTERP(1+nplocx,dplocx,1+nplocy,dplocy);
00449 #undef INTERP
00450                 }
00451             }
00452             }
00453         }/*if ipix*/
00454         }/*limx*/
00455     }/*limy*/
00456     //info2("ampsum=%g\n",ampsum);
00457     if(ampsum>TOL){
00458         ampsum=1./ampsum;
00459     }else{
00460         ampsum=0;
00461     }
00462     for(iw=0; iw<2; iw++){
00463         for(int ii=pp[iw][isa]; ii<count[iw]; ii++){
00464         px[iw][ii]*=ampsum;
00465         }
00466     }
00467         //raise(SIGSEGV);
00468     }/*isa*/
00469     for(iw=0; iw<2; iw++){
00470     if(count[iw]>nzmax[iw]){
00471         error("Over flow\n");//should never happen
00472     }
00473     pp[iw][nsa]=count[iw];
00474     spsetnzmax(GS0t[iw],count[iw]);
00475     }
00476     if(ploc->map){
00477     free(ploc->map->p);
00478     free(ploc->map);
00479     ploc->map=NULL;
00480     }
00481     if(xloc->map){
00482     free(xloc->map->p);
00483     free(xloc->map);
00484     xloc->map=NULL;
00485     }
00486     if(ampcopy!=amp)
00487     free(ampcopy);
00488     //concatenate x and y gradient operators together.
00489     dsp *GS0=spcat(GS0t[0], GS0t[1],1);
00490     spfree(GS0t[0]); GS0t[0]=NULL;
00491     spfree(GS0t[1]); GS0t[1]=NULL;
00492     loc_free_map(ploc);
00493     loc_free_map(xloc);
00494     return GS0;
00495 }

dsp* mkg ( LOC_T *  xloc,
LOC_T *  ploc,
double *  amp,
LOC_T *  saloc,
int  saorc,
double  scale,
double *  displace,
int  do_partial 
)

Returns the transpose of mkgt(). 

00501                                                                {
00502     dsp *GS0T=mkgt(xloc, ploc, amp, saloc, 
00503            saorc, scale, displace, do_partial);
00504     dsp *GS0=sptrans(GS0T);
00505     spfree(GS0T);
00506     return GS0;
00507 }
